intro: Fleischmannia tysonii, commonly known as the Tyson's fleischmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky soils along canyons and slopes. Fleischmannia tysonii is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
